## Lab Objectives

- Install and run WebODM
- Process a UAS image set
- Generate an orthomosaic, DSM, and point cloud
- Import into GRASS

## Install WebODM

### Manual install



```bash
git clone https://github.com/OpenDroneMap/WebODM --config core.autocrlf=input
cd WebODM
./webodm.sh start
```
Access in browser at `http://localhost:8000`.

### Purchase the WebODM Installer

This is a good option if you do not feel comfortable with GitHub and Docker. It is a one-time purchase
of **under $100.00** and all proceeds support the projcet {{< fa heart >}}.

You can purchase the installer at [here](https://www.opendronemap.org/webodm/download/#installer).

## Login to WebODM

## Add Project

Click the **Add Project** button on the top right corner of your screen.
It will open a modal to add a **New Project**.

Enter a **Project Name** and **Description** then click the "Create Project" button.

![](images/webODM_new_project.png){.lightbox}

The new project will be added to the top of the WebODM dashboard.

![](images/webODM_project_list.png){.lightbox}


## Load Images

Use the subseted imagery from our flight on Sept 17, 2025.

- Data: [Flight Images]({{< var data.lake_wheeler_flight_Sept_17_2025_flight_subset >}}) - photos.

Once you have the data downloaded import click the **Select Images and GCP** button located to the right of the newly created project. Import the images.

## Process Task

WebODM processes UAS data as processing *tasks*. Each task is assigned a **name**, **processing node**, **options**, and a setting to **resize images**.

![](images/webODM_task_options.png){fig-align="center" .lightbox}

A defualt processing node (`node-odm-1`) is created by default when starting WebODM, but other processing nodes can be added (e.g., MicMac, cloud-based). There are multiple default options provided by WebODM.

### Default Options

- Default
- High Resolution
- Fast Orthophoto
- Field
- DSM+DTM
- Forest
- Point of Interest
- Buildings Ultra Quality
- Buildings
- 3D Model
- Volume Analysis
- Multispectral

Or you may choose to use custom parameters by selecting the **Edit** button.

![](images/webODM_edit_task_options.png){fig-align="center" .lightbox}

Today we will use the **Field** preset for our analysis, but we will edit the
options to include DSM and DTM generation.

To do this select the **Field** option then click the edit button. Scroll down the **Edit Task Options**
until you see the options for **dsm** and **dtm**. Enable both the **dsm** and **dtm** then click the **Save** button on the bottom of the **Edit Task Options** modal.

Leave the **resize images** set to the defaults.

Now click the **Review** button.

The options should be set as:

*Options* -  `dsm:true, dtm:true, fast-orthophoto:true, matcher-neighbors:4, sfm-algorithm:planar`

![](images/webODM_task_review.png){fig-align="center" .lightbox}

::: {.callout-warning}
Processing time will vary depending on your computers hardware and Docker settings.
:::

Finally, press the **Start Processing** button.
